item.title: Whitney add a quote by Sophie Kinsella
item.description: "My life has changed, and I'm changing with it." -- Sophie Kinsella

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Sophie Kinsella
item.description: "All this time, I wasn't hungry for success, I was hungry." -- Sophie Kinsella

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Sophie Kinsella
item.description: "If I behave as though this is a completely normal situation, then maybe it will be ..." -- Sophie Kinsella

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Like so many Americans, she was trying to construct a life that made sense from things she found in gift shops." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Jen Lancaster
item.description: "I still believe in the Holy Trinity, except now it's Target, Trader Joe's, and IKEA." -- Jen Lancaster

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "You cannot find peace by avoiding life." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "No need to hurry. No need to sparkle. No need to be anybody but oneself." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Arrange whatever pieces come your way." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "I've never had a moment's doubt. I love you. I believe in you completely. You are my dearest one. My reason for life. Cee" -- Ian McEwan

item.title: Whitney add a quote by George Washington Burnap
item.description: "The grand essentials to happiness in this life are something to do, something to love, and something to hope for." -- George Washington Burnap

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "I’m here. I love you. I don’t care if you need to stay up crying all night long, I will stay with you. There’s nothing you can ever do to lose my love. I will protect you until you die, and after your death I will still protect you. I am stronger than Depression and I am braver than Loneliness and nothing will ever exhaust me." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "If I love you, I will carry for you all your pain, I will assume for you all your debts (in every definition of the word), I will protect you from your own insecurity, I will protect upon you all sorts of good qualities that you have never actually cultivated in yourself and I will buy Christmas presents for your entire family. I will give you the sun and the rain, and if they are not available, I will give you a sun check and a rain check. I will give you all this and more, until I get so exhausted and depleted that the only way I can recover my energy is by becoming infatuated with someone else." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "There are as many nights as days, and the one is just as long as the other in the year's course. Even a happy life cannot be without a measure of darkness, and the word 'happy' would lose its meaning if it were not balanced by sadness." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Whitney add a quote by James Kavanaugh
item.description:
"I am one of the searchers. There are, I believe, millions of us. We are not unhappy, but neither are we really content. We continue to explore life, hoping to uncover its ultimate secret. We continue to explore ourselves, hoping to understand. We like to walk along the beach, we are drawn by the ocean, taken by its power, its unceasing motion, its mystery and unspeakable beauty. We like forests and mountains, deserts and hidden rivers, and the lonely cities as well. Our sadness is as much a part of our lives as is our laughter. To share our sadness with one we love is perhaps as great a joy as we can know - unless it be to share our laughter. We searchers are ambitious only for life itself, for everything beautiful it can provide. Most of all we love and want to be loved. We want to live in a relationship that will not impede our wandering, nor prevent our search, nor lock us in prison walls; that will take us for what little we have to give. We do not want to prove ourselves to another or compete for love.
For wanderers, dreamers, and lovers, for lonely men and women who dare to ask of life everything good and beautiful. It is for those who are too gentle to live among wolves." -- James Kavanaugh

item.title: Whitney add a quote by John Greenleaf Whittier
item.description: "Of all sad words of tongue or pen, the saddest are these, 'It might have been." -- John Greenleaf Whittier

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "When you consider things like the stars, our affairs don't seem to matter very much, do they?" -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Azar Nafisi
item.description: "You get a strange feeling when you're about to leave a place, I told him, like you'll not only miss the people you love but you'll miss the person you are now at this time and this place, because you'll never be this way ever again." -- Azar Nafisi

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "And that is how change happens. One gesture. One person. One moment at a time." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "You can never really know someone completely. That’s why it’s the most terrifying thing in the world, really—taking someone on faith, hoping they’ll take you on faith too. It’s such a precarious balance, It’s a wonder we do it at all. And yet.." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "And for a moment, I understand that I have friends on this lonely path; that sometimes your place is not something you find, but something you have when you need it." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "The answer is dreams. Dreaming on and on. Entering the world of dreams and never coming out. Living in dreams for the rest of time." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "For both of us, it had simply been too enormous an experience. We shared it by <i>not talking about it</i>. Does this make any sense?" -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Two minds with but a single thought, two hearts that beat as one." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Anita Shreve
item.description: "Love is not simply the sum of sweet greetings and wrenching partings and kisses and embraces, but is made up more of the memory of what has happened and the imagining of what is to come." -- Anita Shreve

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Audrey Niffenegger
item.description: "Why is love intensified by absence?" -- Audrey Niffenegger

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafón
item.description: "If you really want to possess a woman, you must think like her, and the first thing to do is win over her soul. The rest, that sweet, soft wrapping that steals away your senses and your virtue, is a bonus." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafón

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description: "Dare I say I miss him? I do. I miss him. I still see him in my dreams. They are nightmares mostly, but nightmares tinged with love. Such is the strangeness of the human heart." -- Yann Martel
